subNodes.conversationText: root
Standing in this clearing is a surprisingly life-like statue of a man carrying a halberd. There is moss growing on the statue and it looks quite weatherworn. It has clearly been here for some time.
Use the Stone to Flesh scroll.

You read the Stone to Flesh scroll. As each spidery word is aired, it crumbles from the page like ash until the page is entirely blank.

There is a blast of light, and the statue glows momentarily.
Continue

Suddenly, the statue before you comes to life, swinging its halberd through thin air with a roar, before unbalancing and collapsing into a heap.

After a moment's silence the man says, "what the hell?"
"You'd been turned into a statue. Er... you might want to rest for a moment, I guess."

"A statue?" The man's jaw drops. "A bloody statue? Was... was that bloody lizard a Basilisk? I knew it! Goddam Geoffrey, I told you it was a bloody Basilisk." He groans. "I don't suppose there was another statue around here was there? A big, dopey looking bloke with a hammer?"
"Not that I've seen. Just you."

"Well, that's something I guess. I always quite like the big lug, even if he was a bit slow. He must have got away." The man lurches to his feet and extends his hand. "I'm Olren of River Ebb. Thank you for rescuing me."
"I'm <FirstName>. Pleased to meet you, Olren."
Olren pauses for a moment. "I... I probably don't really want to know. But what year is it?"
[True] "It is the year 341."

Olren pales. "341? But then I've been here for... well, over twenty years!" He sits down slowly. 

"Marwen... I didn't get back for her."
"I'm sorry. Do you think you will be ok from here?"

"I don't really know. I think so. I... well, I need to get home. Whatever is left of it. Twenty bloody years, by the gods." 

Olren looks a little unsteady on his feet. 

"You have my thanks, <FirstName>. I don't have much to give you in return, but take this key. An old elf sold it to me and Geoffrey and told us it opened a door somewhere deep in this forest.... in an old temple, he said. I'm never going to use it now."
"Thanks. And good luck!"
"I want that halberd as well, Olren."
[False] "It is the year 321."

Olren looks relieved. "Thank the gods! I must have only been out of action for about a year. I thought it might have been so much longer. My Marwen will be waiting for me, she'll be so surprised when I come in through the door! <FirstName>, I cannot thank you enough, but I must go."
"You're welcome. Do you think you will be ok from here?"

Olren stands up confidently. "Oh, yes! Look, I don't have much to give you in return, but take this key. An old elf sold it to me and Geoffrey and told us it opened something deep in this forest.... in an old temple, he said. I'm never going to use it now."

Olren pauses. "Oh, what the hell. Take my halberd too. It's a fine weapon, enchanted. I'm not going to need it any more. I'm going to find my lady and settle down. Raise some kids, you know? Somewhere nice and quiet, where there aren't any freaky stone-gazing lizard monsters."
"Thanks. And good luck!"
With a cheerful wave, Olren sets off on the path back to civilisation.
Continue
"Yeah, great. Where's my reward?"

Olren looks a little unsteady on his feet. 

"I don't have much to give you." He pats down his pockets. "Here, take this key. An old elf sold it to me and Geoffrey and told us it opened a door somewhere deep in this forest.... in an old temple, he said. I'm never going to use it now."
"I guess that will do."
"Right then. Thanks again." So saying, Olren stumbles uncertainly down the path back to civilisation.
Continue
"I want that halberd as well, Olren."
Olren pales. "My halberd? But this is a family weapon. Anyway, I can't give it to you, I need it."
"I guess the key will have to do then. Get out of here."
Olren gives you a short, stiff bow and stumbles uncertainly down the path to civilisation.
Continue
"We saved your life, Olren! I won't ask again. Give me the halberd."

Olren reluctantly hands you the weapon. It is finely made and glows with a soft light.

"At least I won't have to worry about thieves taking all my belongings on the way home," Olren says bitterly, and with a stiff bow stumbles uncertainly down the path back to civilisation.
Continue
Standing in this clearing is a surprisingly life-like statue of a man carrying a halberd. There is moss growing on the statue and it looks quite weatherworn. It has clearly been here for some time.
Leave the statue for now.
